t: Psalm 74
A maskil of Asaph.
O*pn God, why have you rejected us forever? Why*ld does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?
Remember*ln the nation you purchased long ago, the*ld people of your inheritance, whom you redeemed— Mount*ld Zion, where you dwelt.
Turn*ln your steps toward these everlasting ruins, all*ld this destruction the enemy has brought on the sanctuary.
Your*pn foes roared in the place where you met with us; they*ld set up their standards as signs.
They*ln behaved like men wielding axes to*ld cut through a thicket of trees.
They*ln smashed all the carved paneling with*ld their axes and hatchets.
They*ln burned your sanctuary to the ground; they*ld defiled the dwelling place of your Name.
They*ln said in their hearts, “We will crush them completely!” They*ld burned every place where God was worshiped in the land.
We*pn are given no signs from God; no*ld prophets are left, and*ld none of us knows how long this will be.
How*ln long will the enemy mock you, God? Will*ld the foe revile your name forever?
Why*ln do you hold back your hand, your right hand? Take*ld it from the folds of your garment and destroy them!
But*pn God is my King from long ago; he*ld brings salvation on the earth.
It*pn was you who split open the sea by your power; you*ld broke the heads of the monster in the waters.
It*ln was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan and*ld gave it as food to the creatures of the desert.
It*ln was you who opened up springs and streams; you*ld dried up the ever-flowing rivers.
The*ln day is yours, and yours also the night; you*ld established the sun and moon.
It*ln was you who set all the boundaries of the earth; you*ld made both summer and winter.
Remember*pn how the enemy has mocked you, Lord,*s how*ld foolish people have reviled your name.
Do*ln not hand over the life of your dove to wild beasts; do*ld not forget the lives of your afflicted people forever.
Have*ln regard for your covenant, because*ld haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land.
Do*ln not let the oppressed retreat in disgrace; may*ld the poor and needy praise your name.
Rise*ln up, O God, and defend your cause; remember*ld how fools mock you all day long.
Do*ln not ignore the clamor of your adversaries, the*ld uproar of your enemies, which rises continually.
